title: Appraisal
body: The interpretation of an event's significance in terms of goals, values, or norms. Measures: structured interviews and Likert scales. SERA axes: explain, respond, adapt. Field: psychology

title: Empathic Response
body: A response that reflects understanding, concern, or support for another's emotional state. Measures include Empathy Quotient. SERA axes: explain, respond, adapt. Field: psychology

title: Emotion Label Recognition
body: The ability to identify and classify emotional states from cues such as language, facial expression, or tone. Measures: RMET, emotion recognition tasks. SERA axes: sense, adapt. Field: psychology

title: Arousal Regulation
body: The ability to modulate physiological and emotional arousal to remain goal-directed and appropriate. Measures: HRV, cortisol response. SERA axes: sense, explain, respond, adapt. Field: psychology

title: Emotion Co-Regulation
body: Interactive emotional regulation where people adjust their states together. Measures include dyadic coping scales. SERA axes: sense, explain, respond, adapt. Field: psychology

title: Emotional Appropriateness
body: The degree to which an emotional response or behaviour fits social or contextual norms. Measures: social norms questionnaires. SERA axes: explain, respond, adapt. Field: psychology

title: Perspective-Taking
body: The cognitive ability to imagine another person's point of view. Measures: Interpersonal Reactivity Index. SERA axes: explain, respond, adapt. Field: psychology

title: Action Tendency Recognition
body: Understanding what behaviour an emotion is likely to motivate. Measures: action prediction from context. SERA axes: sense, explain, respond. Field: psychology
